content.description: - starts left of Push the Pedal by 5 feet or so   - work up leaning face and jugs   - lots of solid features   - follow grain of flake 3/4 way up and merge left with top out of Push the Pedal
content.protection: solid anchor points top of cliff.

climbs.name: Put Your Guitars Where Your Mouth Is

content.description: - same start as Unravel..about half way up there's a V-ledge   - from V-ledge go left and up/around large flake to top out
content.protection: solid tree and small boulders on top for anchors

content.description: - starts just left of Dust of Saturday and jutting flake at bottom.   - lots of solid holds working up to crimps about 10-15 feet up   - top out just left of small knob
content.protection: solid tree and small boulders   lots of webbing.

content.description: - this route starts about 10 feet to the left of the rock wall.   - work up towards large diagonal slab pointing right with small overhang and crimps   - crux is about 18 feet up.
content.protection: solid tree and small boulders atop cliff.   bring lots of webbing.

content.description: - starts about 20 feet left of the rock fence   - climb/work up the left most diagonal flake with nice rail until about 20 feet up where small ledge   - top out where small knob of rock protrudes....more apparent if looking up towards top of cliff from below.
content.protection: solid tree and small boulders for anchors.    bring lots of webbing.

content.description: - start just left of middle aged tree and follow the diagonal grain/crimps to finish just left of Guitar Where Mouth Is route.
content.protection: solid tree and small boulders on top of cliff   lots webbing.

content.description: - start just left of rock wall   - work up the staggered flakes with solid jugs.
content.protection: solid tree and small boulders at top of cliff for anchor points...bring lots of webbing.

content.description:
This section of rock has great variety of features and some challenging maneuvers.  

  Def want to top rope these climps. 

  All these routes are found LEFT of the obvious dry stacked rock wall just down slope from Warm Up Area.
